references.paper_title: Pointnet: Deep learning on point sets for 3d classification and segmentation
references.reason: This foundational paper introduced PointNet, a pioneering deep learning architecture for processing point cloud data, which is extensively used in the current work for 3D point cloud segmentation.

This highly influential paper demonstrated the few-shot learning capabilities of large language models, providing the theoretical foundation for leveraging LLMs in few-shot 3D point cloud segmentation.
This seminal work introduced the concept of prototype-based networks for few-shot learning, which is the core methodology of many existing FS-3DSeg methods, including the one in this paper.

As one of the first works to explore few-shot learning in the context of 3D point cloud segmentation, it established the benchmark and provided a baseline approach that is directly compared to in the present work.

references.paper_title: Prototype adaption and projection for few-and zero-shot 3d point cloud semantic segmentation
references.reason: This recent work addresses the key challenges of low prototype quality and class information bias in FS-3DSeg, offering a state-of-the-art method that the current work directly builds upon and improves.
